alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Connecticut, including the following county, Litchfield. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving into the area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain has already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Milford, Thomaston, Litchfield, Woodbury Center, New Preston, Oakville, Northwest Harwinton, Terryville, Gaylordsville, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Bethlehem, Washington, Morris, Roxbury, Bridgewater, Bantam and Gulls Hollow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
